𓏏 top ደብር däbr Tērag Taēra "peak" 𓇾
𓈋 𓊌 Tell Dell 𓏏 ⛰ 𓈋𓈋 ⇔ 𓈉 Tal Dual < Tepler Tempel > top
𓈉 𓈊 ⋍ Шkара = 1. Mount 2. Land ⇨ Kar, Sahar𓊖

𒆳 kuršat 𓐍 𓆼 𓋴 𓏏 𓈉 "coast" ( 𒆳𒌓𒋾 kurˢtam-ti )

𓈉 #ḫst 𒅖 kuš₇ ≈ coast 𓈉 #ḫst 𔔉 #castrum <> castle coast 𓈉 #ḫst •krst 𓐍 𓆼 𓋴 𓏏 𓈉 •karst 𒆳 Kuršat <> circ 3 ( •krkst 𓆼 ?? ) 𓈉 #ḫst ≈ 𒅖 kuš7 mountain 𓈉 #ḫst ⋍ 𒆳 KUR-šat Karst court 山 svrt! 𓈉 #ḫst ⋍ 𒆳 ḫan-šat 山 shan-šat “five” ⚠️ ⇔ Kanzel ? 𓈉 #ḫst Küste خِطَّة ḵiṭṭa خطه xatte šat 𒆳
𓈉 #ḫst הstate estate <> Stätte 𓊖 𓊨 𓏏 𓈉 #ḫasata ה.saddle 𒐼𒁕𒀀 sa-da-aˡ "mountains" 𓈋 dual

𓈉 coast

𓈉 cast castle secondary ternary … : 𓈉 cast casting outcast < cursed

𓈉 kur ⋍ mountain (kur, gora, гора, gaara, ghor, girí 𐎙𐎗 ġr сан սար sɑɾ cerro ܛܘܪܐ kĩrĩma… 𐩫𐩥𐩧 KWR )
𓈉 kur ⋍ mountain (кӯҳ, koh, har הר, 'ariya, 'urqu, ἄκρα, … पहाड़ pahāṛ, grabis)
𓈉 curves 𓈎 𓃀 𓄲 𓏛 ق و س q-w-s 𓆙 kurbent 𓐍 curve Kurven ⇔ kurbend/wind

𒁲 ≈ 𓈋 in 𒆳𒁲𒂊 šad-de-e mountain saddle 𓈉𓈋 <> 𓊨 𓏏 𓊖 seat …

By the time of Christ the logosphere was riddled thoroughly with puns, making strict etymology near impossible.

山 Shān Ш Sha 𓈉 ∑sum 三 sān 三 ϣⲟⲙⲛ̄ⲧ 山𓈉 mount

𓈋 2 ṭūrā טוּרָא two-rand dvał dual tulay Tal Brücke⋍Berge
𓈉 2 ṭūrā טוּרָא two-runways 2 TälerInnen
𓈉 3 three טוּרָא ṭūrāi çura ⇔ 𓏘 Kur
𓈉 Three mountains ⇔ 𓏘 Kur cairn grenz
𓈉 山 shan san 三 channel 川 chuān 川 zhen 圳 穿 彡 𓄻 𓄼 Zahn vs 𓄑
𓈉 山 shān Schanze san 三 彡 川 州 𓎛𓆰𓈖𓏌𓏲𓈗𓈘𓈇𓏤 canal شن šen (teen=3 < drain 川)
𓈉 山 shān 산 зунтту zunt:u ⇔ zahn
𓈉 山 shan chuán 川 彡 shān 州 zhoú zone country 𓇾 三
𓈉 #XãT 𓈙𓈇 شط SandStein Shatt Shad Chad 𓆷𓇏𓇐 sweat 水 shuǐ
𓇾 Terrain territory: three countries
𓊖 Kuras four quarters
𓈇 Tawi two lands dual Tal 𓈋 𓈇 dawlant(AR)=state
𓈗 ⲑⲁⲗⲁⲥⲥⲁⲛ 'tall-ocean' 𐎘𐎍𐎘 th-l-th vs three sean𓈖 𓈗 三 sān
𓈗 ocean ⇔ 三 sān ⇔ 𐎘𐎍𐎘 Kuras ⋍ 𐎍 = 3
𓊖𓈉𓊖 crc 𐎘𐎍𐎘 thirth vs th-l-th 3rd

中 Center 𓏶 = 𓈙 Sha + 𒁹 ta/dash ⇔ 𓊌 stone

山 Shān Ш Sha chè 屮 𓇑 < K 𓇑

Goran appears to be of Indo-Iranian origin. The name may be derived from the old Avestan word, gairi, which means mountain.

𓈊 kur(t) ⋍ (high)land 𒆳 KUR 𓈉 ≠ 𓈊 山 çura טוּרָא ṭūrā 𓈋 𓏏 tell
𓈊 cird 𒆳 𐘿 ⛼ 山 三 3 vs 4 𓊖 𐘾 quart 四 sìr *hrids
𓈉 kur ⋍ mountain (kur, gora, гора, gaara, ghor, girí сан սար sɑɾ cerro ܛܘܪܐ kĩrĩma…)
𓈉 kur ⋍ mountain (кӯҳ, koh, har הר, 'ariya, 'urqu, ἄκρα, … पहाड़ pahāṛ, grabis)

Three highest peaks of the Caucasus :
1. 𓈏 𓏏 Минги тау Mingi Taw top tepe 𓈌 Elbrus /ˈɛlbrəs/ Alborz Elburz proto Berg
2. 𓈋 Dykh-Tau Дыхтау "dik dagh" second highest peak ⇔ 丈太 大天 (たけ take …)
3. 𓈉 Shkhara შხარა third highest peak of Caucasian countries

𒄯 Haraitī Guard ♀ ⇔ Hukar Hukairya "of good deeds"
𒄯 Harā Bərəzaitī 𐬵𐬀𐬭𐬁⸱𐬠𐬆𐬭𐬆𐬰𐬀𐬌𐬙𐬍 'High Watchpost' (secondary) Celtic *brigant Brigantes *burgund Burgundians *bʰérǵʰonts
𒄯𒁀𒋗 ḫur-ba-šu | hoar frost

Used as letter S in Hyksos 𓋾𓏘𓈉, coevolved with
𓈉𓇏𓇐𓆷 swamp ∑Шwamp
